normalised: **five G Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi: The nationwide 5G rollout is picking up pace, with telecom operators like Airtel and Jio expanding their networks rapidly across major Indian cities. Reliance Jio announced today, 20/10/2024, that it has crossed the 100,000-site milestone, covering a significant portion of the national territory.
normalised: New Delhi: The nationwide five G rollout is picking up pace, with telecom operators like Airtel and Jio expanding their networks rapidly across major Indian cities. Reliance Jio announced today, twentieth october two thousand and twenty four, that it has crossed the one hundred thousand-site milestone, covering a significant portion of the national territory.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel also unveiled plans to invest an additional Rs. 20,000 crore in 5G infrastructure over the next fiscal year, focusing on rural areas beyond the metros. This expansion aims to bridge the digital divide and bring high-speed internet connectivity to the hinterlands, crucial for initiatives like Digital India.
normalised: Bharti Airtel also unveiled plans to invest an additional rupee twenty thousand crore in five G infrastructure over the next fiscal year, focusing on rural areas beyond the metros. This expansion aims to bridge the digital divide and bring high-speed internet connectivity to the hinterlands, crucial for initiatives like Digital India.

unnormalised: "We are committed to connecting every village, every 'gaon', with the power of 5G," said Mr. Sharma, a telecom regulator during a conference at IIT-Bombay on 15/08/2024. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is also playing a vital role, conducting spectrum auctions and ensuring fair competition. Analysts predict that 5G will contribute significantly to India's GDP growth by 2027, boosting sectors like manufacturing and healthcare. Early reports from beta users at 09:00 hrs this morning, 21/10/2024, suggest speeds exceeding 1 Gbps in optimal conditions. Furthermore, the government plans to lay an additional 5,000 km of optic fiber cable by the end of the year to support the increased bandwidth demand.
normalised: "We are committed to connecting every village, every 'gaon', with the power of five G," said Mister Sharma, a telecom regulator during a conference at I I T-Bombay on fifteenth august two thousand and twenty four. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) is also playing a vital role, conducting spectrum auctions and ensuring fair competition. Analysts predict that five G will contribute significantly to India's G D P growth by two thousand and twenty seven, boosting sectors like manufacturing and healthcare. Early reports from beta users at nine zero zero hours this morning, twenty first october two thousand and twenty four, suggest speeds exceeding one G b p s in optimal conditions. Furthermore, the government plans to lay an additional five thousand kilometer of optic fiber cable by the end of the year to support the increased bandwidth demand.
